qas.question: How many people saw the first step onto the Moon?
When did they launch from the Moon to reattach to the Columbia?

context: The first step was witnessed by at least one-fifth of the population of Earth, or about <a0_0>723 million<a0_0/> people. His first words when he stepped off the LM's landing footpad were, "That's one small step for [a] man, one giant leap for mankind." Aldrin joined him on the surface almost 20 minutes later. Altogether, they spent just under two and one-quarter hours outside their craft. <a1_0>The next day<a1_0/>, they performed the first launch from another celestial body, and rendezvoused back with Columbia.
